channel.title: Rename the prince's execution ability or the court's executions
channel.description:
The game uses "execute" for two different things - the prince's execution ability, and the town voting up someone and killing them. This leads to unnecessary confusion when discussing events, so one of the two should probably be renamed.
I don't care which one; there's arguments for each. Renaming the Prince's execution is probably [i]easier[/i], since you could just change the name of the button he pushes.
It could be something like "condemn" or "behead" or "eliminate" or something; maybe someone else has a suggestion. The important thing is that the game shouldn't use the same word for two distinct in-game actions.

item.title: Rename the prince's execution ability or the court's executions
item.dc:creator: Jaliborc

item.title: Rename the prince's execution ability or the court's executions
item.dc:creator: PokemonKidRyan
item.description:
I still think it works well as it is tbh.
People can literally say that the Prince should execute someone, so there’s a clear difference in the wording.
